Select a subset of cases

Source: R/select_cases.R
select_cases.Rd

Select a subset of cases

select_cases(scdf, ...)

Arguments

scdf

A single-case data frame. See scdf to learn about this format.
...

Selection criteria. Either numeric or as characters.

Value

An scdf with a subset of cases

Examples

select_cases(exampleAB, "Johanna", "Karolina")

#> #A single-case data frame with 2 cases
#> 
#>  Johanna: phase values mt | Karolina: phase values mt |
#>               A     54  1 |               A     41  1 |
#>               A     53  2 |               A     59  2 |
#>               A     56  3 |               A     56  3 |
#>               A     58  4 |               A     51  4 |
#>               A     52  5 |               A     52  5 |
#>               B     61  6 |               B     57  6 |
#>               B     62  7 |               B     56  7 |
#>               B     71  8 |               B     67  8 |
#>               B     66  9 |               B     75  9 |
#>               B     64 10 |               B     66 10 |
#>               B     78 11 |               B     69 11 |
#>               B     70 12 |               B     68 12 |
#>               B     74 13 |               B     73 13 |
#>               B     82 14 |               B     77 14 |
#>               B     77 15 |               B     79 15 |
#> # ... up to 5 more rows
# or: select_cases(exampleAB, c("Johanna", "Karolina"))
select_cases(exampleAB, 1,2)

#> #A single-case data frame with 2 cases
#> 
#>  Johanna: phase values mt | Karolina: phase values mt |
#>               A     54  1 |               A     41  1 |
#>               A     53  2 |               A     59  2 |
#>               A     56  3 |               A     56  3 |
#>               A     58  4 |               A     51  4 |
#>               A     52  5 |               A     52  5 |
#>               B     61  6 |               B     57  6 |
#>               B     62  7 |               B     56  7 |
#>               B     71  8 |               B     67  8 |
#>               B     66  9 |               B     75  9 |
#>               B     64 10 |               B     66 10 |
#>               B     78 11 |               B     69 11 |
#>               B     70 12 |               B     68 12 |
#>               B     74 13 |               B     73 13 |
#>               B     82 14 |               B     77 14 |
#>               B     77 15 |               B     79 15 |
#> # ... up to 5 more rows
# or: select_cases(exampleAB, 1:2)
select_cases(exampleAB, "-Johanna")

#> #A single-case data frame with 2 cases
#> 
#>  Karolina: phase values mt | Anja: phase values mt |
#>                A     41  1 |           A     55  1 |
#>                A     59  2 |           A     58  2 |
#>                A     56  3 |           A     53  3 |
#>                A     51  4 |           A     50  4 |
#>                A     52  5 |           A     52  5 |
#>                B     57  6 |           B     55  6 |
#>                B     56  7 |           B     68  7 |
#>                B     67  8 |           B     68  8 |
#>                B     75  9 |           B     81  9 |
#>                B     66 10 |           B     67 10 |
#>                B     69 11 |           B     78 11 |
#>                B     68 12 |           B     73 12 |
#>                B     73 13 |           B     72 13 |
#>                B     77 14 |           B     78 14 |
#>                B     79 15 |           B     81 15 |
#> # ... up to 5 more rows
# or: select_cases(exampleAB, c("-Johanna", "-Karolina"))
